name: United Arab Emirates (UAE)
risk_summary: Layered restrictions across Dubai (VARA), DIFC (DFSA), and federal payments (CBUAE) with explicit prohibitions for anonymity-enhanced / privacy tokens in regulated contexts.
team_guidance: Avoid locating regulated operations supporting privacy assets (custody/exchange/payment services).
Avoid marketing or distributing privacy-token services into UAE without specific local legal approval.
Assume partners (banks/PSPs/exchanges) will refuse privacy-asset integrations.

name: Japan
risk_summary: Registered exchanges have delisted high-anonymity assets under JVCEA/FSA pressure; commercial rails for privacy assets are constrained.
team_guidance: Assume exchange/partner support for privacy assets will be limited or unavailable.
Wallet-only distribution may be possible but partner-dependent features should be treated as incompatible.

name: South Korea
risk_summary: VASP regulation forbids transactions with 'dark coins' / privacy coins; licensed partners will not support privacy assets.
team_guidance: Treat as incompatible for custody/exchange roadmap involving privacy assets.
Avoid local-facing marketing or support for privacy-asset services.

name: Thailand
risk_summary: Licensed digital asset business operators are prohibited from providing privacy coin services that conceal key transaction data.
team_guidance: Do not build or operate licensed service models involving privacy-coin services in Thailand.
Wallet-only distribution may still face partner and marketing constraints.

name: European Union (EU)
risk_summary: EU AMLR restricts anonymous/obfuscated accounts for CASPs; software/self-hosted wallets can be acceptable if the provider has no access/control. Regulated rails are likely to delist/refuse privacy assets.
team_guidance: Keep the wallet strictly non-custodial (no key escrow, no hosted signing).
Avoid EU CASP strategy depending on privacy-coin listings.
Expect friction with banks/PSPs; design fallbacks.

name: India
risk_summary: Watch jurisdiction due to likely partner delistings and evolving AML posture toward privacy tokens.
team_guidance: Treat as wallet-only unless counsel confirms otherwise.
Plan for sudden exchange/partner restrictions on privacy assets.

name: Switzerland
risk_summary: Comparatively stable, pro-innovation environment for non-custodial software development; no categorical software ban identified in the deck.
team_guidance: Good base for R&D and operations for a non-custodial wallet.
Still perform AML/partner diligence; do not treat as a safe harbor.

name: United States
risk_summary: Non-custodial architecture reduces licensing perimeter versus running a hosted service; enforcement risk rises for hosted services and sanctions-sensitive activity.
team_guidance: Keep non-custodial posture; avoid hosted services around privacy assets.
Be conservative around sanctions/compliance sensitive integrations.

name: Singapore
risk_summary: Clear licensing frameworks with strict AML/CFT expectations; treat privacy features as higher risk for partners.
team_guidance: Good hub for compliant product teams; maintain conservative posture for retail marketing.
Assume partners may impose extra diligence for privacy assets.
